cards.description: A vehicle with four wheels that is powered by an engine and used for transportation.
A large vehicle designed to carry many passengers, typically along a fixed route.
A connected series of railroad cars propelled along a track by a locomotive or self-propelled engine.
A vehicle with two wheels that is propelled by pedals and steered with handlebars.
A two-wheeled vehicle that is powered by an engine and typically has a saddle for the rider.
A vehicle that can be hired to transport people from one place to another for a fare.
An underground electric railway system in a city, consisting of interconnected tunnels and stations.
A powered flying vehicle with fixed wings and a weight greater than that of the air it displaces.
A type of aircraft that derives its lift from blades that rotate around a central mast.
A small vessel for traveling on water, propelled by oars, sails, or an engine.
A large vessel for transporting people or goods by sea.
A boat or ship used to transport passengers and sometimes vehicles across a body of water.
A large, heavy motor vehicle used for transporting goods, materials, or troops.
A covered vehicle used for transporting goods or people, typically without windows at the sides.
A short form of 'bicycle', a vehicle with two wheels that is propelled by pedals.
A short form of 'motorcycle', a two-wheeled vehicle that is powered by an engine.
A small, typically two-wheeled vehicle propelled by an electric motor or a gasoline engine.
A type of aircraft propelled by jet engines, used for transporting passengers or military purposes.
A passenger vehicle that runs on tracks laid in a street, typically serving urban areas.
A large passenger ship used mainly for pleasure voyages, typically with facilities for recreation and entertainment.

A savory dish of Italian origin consisting of a usually round, flattened base of leavened wheat-based dough topped with tomatoes, cheese, and often various other ingredients such as anchovies, mushrooms, onions, olives, pineapple, meat, etc.
A sandwich consisting of one or more cooked patties of ground meat, usually beef, placed inside a sliced bread roll or bun.
A Japanese dish consisting of small balls or rolls of vinegar-flavored cold cooked rice served with a garnish of raw fish, vegetables, or egg.
